conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each starting point (A, B, C, and D) as it interacts with the baffles.
Liquid starts at A and encounters the first baffle angled downwards to the right.
Liquid will follow the slope of the baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid encounters the second baffle angled downwards to the left.
Liquid will follow this baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid reaches the bottom and flows into container E.
Liquid starts at B and encounters the first baffle angled downwards to the right.
Liquid will follow the slope of the baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid encounters the second baffle angled downwards to the left.
Liquid will follow this baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid reaches the bottom and flows into container E.
Liquid starts at C and encounters the first baffle angled downwards to the right.
Liquid will follow the slope of the baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid encounters the second baffle angled downwards to the left.
Liquid will follow this baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid reaches the bottom and flows into container G.
Liquid starts at D and encounters the first baffle angled downwards to the right.
Liquid will follow the slope of the baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid encounters the second baffle angled downwards to the left.
Liquid will follow this baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid reaches the bottom and flows into container G.
Liquid from A will flow into container E.
Liquid from B will flow into container E.
Liquid from C will flow into container G.
Liquid from D will flow into container G.
